title: Business & Finance
text:
---

Boeing agreed to pay $200 million to settle an SEC probe into allegations that the plane maker and former CEO Muilenburg made misleading statements about the 737 MAX's safety risks after two of the jets crashed.

---

FedEx said it plans to raise shipping rates by an average of 6.9% starting in January as the company copes with a global slowdown in deliveries.

---

U.S. stocks dropped, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials posting losses of 0.8%, 1.4% and 0.4%, respectively.

---

Ancora , the activist investor that helped install three directors on the Kohl's board last year, is now trying to force out the retailer's chairman and CEO.

---

Humana and CVS Health are circling Cano Health , according to people familiar with the situation, as healthcare heavyweights scramble to snap up primary-care providers.

---

U.S. regulators have begun inspecting China-based audits, kicking off a process that will determine whether companies from Alibaba to Yum China can remain listed on U.S. stock exchanges.
